message: what are the best practices for android development with ionic framework ?

data.message: I'm not sure this is the best place to ask such a question

My opinion, use ionic only with prototype projects or startups, don't use it with large scale or complicated projects.
There's many disadvantage for using ionic instead of native like anyone can review ur ionic code , http/s apis or take  ur ionic app and change the logo/ name and put it on google market again by his name with few easy steps. But ionic nice for speed up your release and test ur market for startups

Ur question is weird or wrong, ionic is primary for hyprid app dev.  
if u r using it to just develop android one, why not build a native one? another thing, ionic follows angular framework architecture, so, it depends really on what u r building, performance in angular is really tricky, and it usually takes some experience to avoid performance or scalability issues.
I also suggest u use graphQL with firebase instead of endpoints with Restful APIs, it's a break through in client sides app development.
